subject: Charles Osgood: The growing U.S. wealth gap
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






April 13, 2007
Hello, everyone,
Hope 
      you’ve had a good week.
This Sunday is April 15 – an infamous date 
      for the American taxpayer. But not for every taxpayer. This Sunday 
      Morning, in our Cover Story, our Rita Braver looks at how a 
      small percentage of Americans continue to grow wealthier, while middle class Americans are 
      increasingly caught in the middle, 
      not earning enough money, and facing a growing mound of 
      expenses. 
Most 
      of us know Tiffany & Co. for its silver and 
      jewelry.  Fewer of us may be aware of the work of Louis Comfort 
      Tiffany, an heir to the 
      Tiffany legacy whose artistry was expressed in stained glass – lamps 
      and other glass works that are prized for their beauty and elegance. 
      Martha Teichner will tell us all about it.

We have two interviews of note this 
      weekend.
Anthony Mason will sit down 
      with Alfred Taubman, the shopping mall magnate who took over the famed 
      Sotheby’s art auction house, and was 
      later sent to jail on charges of price fixing. Taubman speaks his mind in 
      a candid interview. 

And Tracy Smith takes a 
      walk down Memory Lane with actor Liev Schreiber, who talks about his eccentric childhood 
      in New York’s East Village, his 
      acting career, and the child he is 
      having with actress Naomi Watts. 
Those 
      stories, plus Bill Geist with a 
      dogged artist whose work is the talk of Bermuda (since he’s a dog!), this Sunday 
      Morning.
 Listen for our trumpet.
